conversation_contexts: trusting ## I'm teaching my daughter how to drive, and so far, so good!

turns.text: I was surprised to find I loved The Walking Dead. Not my style, usually. Do you watch?
I tried a few times but found it wasn't for me. I like zombie games though. How about you? I play on the PS4.
Well, after a few seasons, it really just felt tooooo dark and inescapable. I guess zombies will do that to you...! What's your favorite game?
I enjoy strategy games the most. One of my favorites is Plants Vs. Zombies. Have you played that one? It's about homeowners that use plants to try and stop zombies from invading.

I haven't -- but know lots of people who love that one. It's had some longevity too, hasn't it? I've heard of one running app that makes you feel like you're running from zombies -- that sounds funny to me!
That's true. It has been around for a while. It's made it through iOS, PS3, PS4, etc. Lots of places to play that game. I think that you can even play it on the IPad!

turns.text: Even though having a broken heart is part of our survival instinct, I really try to overcome it however possible.
Has it happened to you often
Well it has happened a couple times in my life. The pain wasn't so severe as to cause physical damage, as happens in "broken heart syndrome".
Oh wow people actually suffer physical damage?
Yes, the heart can have trouble doing it's job of supplying blood, oxygen, and nutrients adequately - I guess it is from the depression and anxiety that often accompanies the state of mind.
That is amazing. Can it actually be fatal?
I would imagine that it is possible, since it does does to the heart. But, the anxiety is probably the wort part of it, physical symptoms such as fast heart rate and shakiness.

original_text: I would imagine that it is possible, since it does does to the heart. But, the anxiety is probably the wort part of it, physical symptoms such as fast heart rate and shakiness.
